Jetpack Compose (Kotlin JVM) with Material Design principles or SwiftUI (Swift) for native apps targeted at either Android or iOS, respectively.

   261	    def init_next_round_input(self, tree_cache: Optional[BasePrefixCache] = None):
   262	        self.fill_ids = self.origin_input_ids + self.output_ids
   263	        if tree_cache is not None:

   269	    def adjust_max_prefix_ids(self):
   270	        self.fill_ids = self.origin_input_ids + self.output_ids
   271	        input_len = len(self.fill_ids)
   272	
   273	        # FIXME: To work around some bugs in logprob computation, we need to ensure each
   274	        # request has at least one token. Later, we can relax this requirement and use `input_len`.
   275	        max_prefix_len = input_len - 1

   277	        if self.sampling_params.max_new_tokens > 0:
   278	            # Need at least one token to compute logits
   279	            max_prefix_len = min(max_prefix_len, input_len - 1)

   281	        if self.return_logprob:
   282	            if self.normalized_prompt_logprob is None:
   283	                # Need at least two tokens to compute normalized logprob
   284	                max_prefix_len = min(max_prefix_len, input_len - 2)

   290	    # Based on https://github.com/vllm-project/vllm/blob/7a64d24aad69e4d2548aa0bf528d9fe63428ab01/vllm/transformers_utils/detokenizer.py#L194-L313
   291	    def init_incremental_detokenize(self):
   292	        first_iter = self.surr_offset is None or self.read_offset is None
   293	
   294	        if first_iter:
   295	            self.read_offset = len(self.origin_input_ids_unpadded)
   296	            self.surr_offset = max(
   297	                self.read_offset - INIT_INCREMENTAL_DETOKENIZATION_OFFSET, 0

   303	    def get_next_inc_detokenization(self):
   304	        if self.tokenizer is None:
   305	            return False, ""
   306	        read_ids, read_offset = self.init_incremental_detokenize()
   307	        surr_ids = read_ids[:read_offset]
   308	
   309	        surr_text = self.tokenizer.decode(
   310	            surr_ids,
   311	            skip_special_tokens=self.sampling_params.skip_special_tokens,
   312	            spaces_between_special_tokens=self.sampling_params.spaces_between_special_tokens,
   313	        )
   314	        new_text = self.tokenizer.decode(
   315	            read_ids,
   316	            skip_special_tokens=self.sampling_params.skip_special_tokens,
   317	            spaces_between_special_tokens=self.sampling_params.spaces_between_special_tokens,
   318	        )
   319	
   320	        if len(new_text) > len(surr_text) and not new_text.endswith("�"):
   321	            return True, new_text[len(surr_text) :]
   322	
   323	        return False, ""

   325	    def check_finished(self):
   326	        if self.finished():
   327	            return
   328	
   329	        if len(self.output_ids) >= self.sampling_params.max_new_tokens:
   330	            self.finished_reason = FINISH_LENGTH(
   331	                length=self.sampling_params.max_new_tokens
   332	            )
   333	            return
   334	
   335	        last_token_id = self.output_ids[-1]
   336	
   337	        matched_eos = False
   338	
   339	        # Check stop token ids
   340	        if self.sampling_params.stop_token_ids:
   341	            matched_eos = last_token_id in self.sampling_params.stop_token_ids
   342	        if self.tokenizer is not None:
   343	            matched_eos |= last_token_id == self.tokenizer.eos_token_id
   344	            if self.tokenizer.additional_stop_token_ids:
   345	                matched_eos |= last_token_id in self.tokenizer.additional_stop_token_ids
   346	        if matched_eos and not self.sampling_params.ignore_eos:
   347	            self.finished_reason = FINISH_MATCHED_TOKEN(matched=last_token_id)
   348	            return
   349	
   350	        # Check stop strings
   351	        if len(self.sampling_params.stop_strs) > 0:
   352	            tail_str = self.tokenizer.decode(
   353	                self.output_ids[-(self.sampling_params.stop_str_max_len + 1) :]
   354	            )
   355	
   356	            for stop_str in self.sampling_params.stop_strs:
   357	                if stop_str in tail_str or stop_str in self.decoded_text:
   358	                    self.finished_reason = FINISH_MATCHED_STR(matched=stop_str)
   359	                    return

   361	    def jump_forward_and_retokenize(self, jump_forward_str, next_state):
   362	        if self.origin_input_text is None:
   363	            # Recovering text can only use unpadded ids
   364	            self.origin_input_text = self.tokenizer.decode(
   365	                self.origin_input_ids_unpadded
   366	            )
   367	
   368	        all_text = self.origin_input_text + self.decoded_text + jump_forward_str
   369	        all_ids = self.tokenizer.encode(all_text)
   370	        if not all_ids:
   371	            logger.warning("Encoded all_text resulted in empty all_ids")
   372	            return False
   373	
   374	        prompt_tokens = len(self.origin_input_ids_unpadded)
   375	        if prompt_tokens > len(all_ids):
   376	            logger.warning("prompt_tokens is larger than encoded all_ids")
   377	            return False
   378	
   379	        if all_ids[prompt_tokens - 1] != self.origin_input_ids_unpadded[-1]:
   380	            # TODO(lsyin): fix token fusion
   381	            logger.warning(
   382	                "Token fusion between input and output, try to avoid this by removing the space at the end of the input."
   383	            )
   384	            return False
   385	
   386	        old_output_ids = self.output_ids
   387	        self.output_ids = all_ids[prompt_tokens:]
   388	        self.decoded_text = self.decoded_text + jump_forward_str
   389	        self.surr_offset = prompt_tokens
   390	        self.read_offset = len(all_ids)
   391	
   392	        # NOTE: A trick to reduce the surrouding tokens decoding overhead
   393	        for i in range(0, INIT_INCREMENTAL_DETOKENIZATION_OFFSET):
   394	            surr_text_ = self.tokenizer.decode(
   395	                all_ids[self.read_offset - i : self.read_offset]
   396	            )
   397	            if not surr_text_.endswith("�"):
   398	                self.surr_offset = self.read_offset - i
   399	                break
   400	
   401	        self.regex_fsm_state = next_state
   402	
   403	        if self.return_logprob:
   404	            # For fast-forward part's logprobs
   405	            k = 0
   406	            for i, old_id in enumerate(old_output_ids):
   407	                if old_id == self.output_ids[i]:
   408	                    k = k + 1
   409	                else:
   410	                    break
   411	            self.output_token_logprobs = self.output_token_logprobs[:k]
   412	            self.output_top_logprobs = self.output_top_logprobs[:k]
   413	            self.logprob_start_len = prompt_tokens + k
   414	            self.last_update_decode_tokens = len(self.output_ids) - k
   415	
   416	        return True

   419	        return f"rid(n={self.rid}, " f"input_ids={self.origin_input_ids}, "

   504	    def alloc_req_slots(self, num_reqs):
   505	        req_pool_indices = self.req_to_token_pool.alloc(num_reqs)
   506	        if req_pool_indices is None:
   507	            raise RuntimeError(
   508	                "Out of memory. "
   509	                "Please set a smaller number for `--max-running-requests`."
   510	            )
   511	        return req_pool_indices
   512	
   513	    def alloc_token_slots(self, num_tokens: int):
   514	        out_cache_loc = self.token_to_kv_pool.alloc(num_tokens)
   515	
   516	        if out_cache_loc is None:
   517	            if self.tree_cache is not None:
   518	                self.tree_cache.evict(num_tokens, self.token_to_kv_pool.free)
   519	                out_cache_loc = self.token_to_kv_pool.alloc(num_tokens)
   520	
   521	            if out_cache_loc is None:
   522	                phase_str = "Prefill" if self.forward_mode.is_extend() else "Decode"
   523	                logger.error(
   524	                    f"{phase_str} out of memory. Try to lower your batch size.\n"
   525	                    f"Try to allocate {num_tokens} tokens.\n"
   526	                    f"Avaliable tokens: {self.token_to_kv_pool.available_size() + self.tree_cache.evictable_size()}\n"
   527	                )
   528	                if self.tree_cache is not None:
   529	                    self.tree_cache.pretty_print()
   530	                exit(1)
   531	
   532	        return out_cache_loc

   534	    def prepare_encoder_info_extend(self, input_ids: List[int], seq_lens: List[int]):
   535	        self.encoder_lens_cpu = []
   536	        self.encoder_cached = []
   537	
   538	        for req in self.reqs:
   539	            im = req.image_inputs
   540	            if im is None or im.num_image_tokens is None:
   541	                # No image input
   542	                self.encoder_lens_cpu.append(0)
   543	                self.encoder_cached.append(True)
   544	            else:
   545	                self.encoder_lens_cpu.append(im.num_image_tokens)
   546	                self.encoder_cached.append(
   547	                    self.forward_mode.is_decode()
   548	                    or len(req.prefix_indices) >= im.num_image_tokens
   549	                )
   550	
   551	        self.encoder_lens = torch.tensor(self.encoder_lens_cpu, dtype=torch.int32).to(
   552	            self.device, non_blocking=True
   553	        )
   554	
   555	        # Strip encoder infos
   556	        pt = 0
   557	        decoder_out_cache_loc = []
   558	        encoder_out_cache_loc = []
   559	        for i, req in enumerate(self.reqs):
   560	            encoder_len = self.encoder_lens_cpu[i]
   561	            seq_lens[i] -= encoder_len
   562	
   563	            if len(req.prefix_indices) < encoder_len:
   564	                # NOTE: the encoder part should considered as a whole
   565	                assert len(req.prefix_indices) == 0
   566	                input_ids[i] = input_ids[i][encoder_len:]
   567	                encoder_out_cache_loc.append(self.out_cache_loc[pt : pt + encoder_len])
   568	                decoder_out_cache_loc.append(
   569	                    self.out_cache_loc[pt + encoder_len : pt + req.extend_input_len]
   570	                )
   571	                self.extend_lens[i] -= encoder_len
   572	                self.extend_num_tokens -= encoder_len
   573	            else:
   574	                decoder_out_cache_loc.append(
   575	                    self.out_cache_loc[pt : pt + req.extend_input_len]
   576	                )
   577	                self.prefix_lens[i] -= encoder_len
   578	
   579	            pt += req.extend_input_len
   580	
   581	        # Reassign
   582	        self.input_ids = torch.tensor(sum(input_ids, []), dtype=torch.int32).to(
   583	            self.device, non_blocking=True
   584	        )
   585	        self.seq_lens = torch.tensor(seq_lens, dtype=torch.int32).to(
   586	            self.device, non_blocking=True
   587	        )
   588	
   589	        if not decoder_out_cache_loc:
   590	            self.out_cache_loc = torch.empty(0, dtype=torch.int32).to(
   591	                self.device, non_blocking=True
   592	            )
   593	        else:
   594	            self.out_cache_loc = torch.cat(decoder_out_cache_loc)
   595	
   596	        if not encoder_out_cache_loc:
   597	            self.encoder_out_cache_loc = torch.empty(0, dtype=torch.int32).to(
   598	                self.device, non_blocking=True
   599	            )
   600	        else:
   601	            self.encoder_out_cache_loc = torch.cat(encoder_out_cache_loc)
   602	
   603	        assert len(self.out_cache_loc) == self.extend_num_tokens

   605	    def prepare_for_extend(self):
   606	        self.forward_mode = ForwardMode.EXTEND
   607	
   608	        bs = len(self.reqs)
   609	        reqs = self.reqs
   610	        input_ids = [r.fill_ids[len(r.prefix_indices) :] for r in reqs]
   611	        extend_num_tokens = sum(len(ids) for ids in input_ids)
   612	        seq_lens = []
   613	
   614	        # Allocate memory
   615	        req_pool_indices = self.alloc_req_slots(bs)
   616	        out_cache_loc = self.alloc_token_slots(extend_num_tokens)
   617	
   618	        pt = 0
   619	        for i, req in enumerate(reqs):
   620	            already_computed = (
   621	                req.extend_logprob_start_len + 1 + req.cached_tokens
   622	                if req.extend_logprob_start_len > 0
   623	                else 0
   624	            )
   625	            req.cached_tokens += len(req.prefix_indices) - already_computed
   626	
   627	            req.req_pool_idx = req_pool_indices[i]
   628	            pre_len, seq_len = len(req.prefix_indices), len(req.fill_ids)
   629	            seq_lens.append(seq_len)
   630	            assert seq_len - pre_len == req.extend_input_len
   631	
   632	            if pre_len > 0:
   633	                self.req_to_token_pool.write(
   634	                    (req.req_pool_idx, slice(0, pre_len)), req.prefix_indices
   635	                )
   636	            self.req_to_token_pool.write(
   637	                (req.req_pool_idx, slice(pre_len, seq_len)),
   638	                out_cache_loc[pt : pt + req.extend_input_len],
   639	            )
   640	
   641	            # Compute the relative logprob_start_len in an extend batch
   642	            if req.logprob_start_len >= pre_len:
   643	                extend_logprob_start_len = min(
   644	                    req.logprob_start_len - pre_len, req.extend_input_len - 1
   645	                )
   646	            else:
   647	                extend_logprob_start_len = req.extend_input_len - 1
   648	
   649	            req.extend_logprob_start_len = extend_logprob_start_len
   650	            pt += req.extend_input_len
   651	
   652	        # Set fields
   653	        self.input_ids = torch.tensor(sum(input_ids, []), dtype=torch.int32).to(
   654	            self.device, non_blocking=True
   655	        )
   656	        self.req_pool_indices = torch.tensor(req_pool_indices, dtype=torch.int32).to(
   657	            self.device, non_blocking=True
   658	        )
   659	        self.seq_lens = torch.tensor(seq_lens, dtype=torch.int32).to(
   660	            self.device, non_blocking=True
   661	        )
   662	
   663	        self.out_cache_loc = out_cache_loc
   664	
   665	        self.seq_lens_sum = sum(seq_lens)
   666	        if self.return_logprob:
   667	            self.top_logprobs_nums = [r.top_logprobs_num for r in reqs]
   668	        self.extend_num_tokens = extend_num_tokens
   669	        self.prefix_lens = [len(r.prefix_indices) for r in reqs]
   670	        self.extend_lens = [r.extend_input_len for r in reqs]
   671	        self.extend_logprob_start_lens = [r.extend_logprob_start_len for r in reqs]
   672	
   673	        if self.model_config.is_encoder_decoder:

   675	
   676	        self.sampling_info = SamplingBatchInfo.from_schedule_batch(
   677	            self,
   678	            self.model_config.vocab_size,
   679	            global_server_args_dict["disable_penalizer"],
   680	        )

   682	    def mix_with_running(self, running_batch: "ScheduleBatch"):
   683	        self.forward_mode = ForwardMode.MIXED
   684	        running_bs = running_batch.batch_size()
   685	
   686	        for req in running_batch.reqs:
   687	            req.fill_ids = req.origin_input_ids + req.output_ids
   688	            req.extend_input_len = 1
   689	
   690	        input_ids = torch.cat([self.input_ids, running_batch.input_ids])
   691	        out_cache_loc = torch.cat([self.out_cache_loc, running_batch.out_cache_loc])
   692	
   693	        self.merge_batch(running_batch)
   694	        self.input_ids = input_ids
   695	        self.out_cache_loc = out_cache_loc
   696	        self.extend_num_tokens += running_bs
   697	
   698	        # NOTE: prefix_indices is what has been cached, but we don't cache each decode step
   699	        self.prefix_lens.extend(
   700	            [
   701	                len(r.origin_input_ids) + len(r.output_ids) - 1
   702	                for r in running_batch.reqs
   703	            ]
   704	        )
   705	        self.extend_lens.extend([1] * running_bs)
   706	        self.extend_logprob_start_lens.extend([0] * running_bs)
   707	
   708	    def check_decode_mem(self):
   709	        bs = len(self.reqs)
   710	        if self.token_to_kv_pool.available_size() >= bs:
   711	            return True
   712	
   713	        self.tree_cache.evict(bs, self.token_to_kv_pool.free)
   714	
   715	        if self.token_to_kv_pool.available_size() >= bs:
   716	            return True
   717	
   718	        return False

   720	    def retract_decode(self):
   721	        sorted_indices = [i for i in range(len(self.reqs))]
   722	
   723	        # TODO(lsyin): improve retraction policy for radix cache
   724	        sorted_indices.sort(
   725	            key=lambda i: (
   726	                len(self.reqs[i].output_ids),
   727	                -len(self.reqs[i].origin_input_ids),
   728	            ),
   729	            reverse=True,
   730	        )
   731	
   732	        retracted_reqs = []
   733	        seq_lens_cpu = self.seq_lens.cpu().numpy()
   734	        first_iter = True
   735	        while (
   736	            self.token_to_kv_pool.available_size()
   737	            < len(sorted_indices) * global_config.retract_decode_steps
   738	            or first_iter
   739	        ):
   740	            if len(sorted_indices) == 1:
   741	                # Corner case: only one request left
   742	                assert (
   743	                    self.token_to_kv_pool.available_size() > 0
   744	                ), "No space left for only one request"
   745	                break
   746	
   747	            first_iter = False
   748	            idx = sorted_indices.pop()
   749	            req = self.reqs[idx]
   750	            retracted_reqs.append(req)
   751	
   752	            if isinstance(self.tree_cache, ChunkCache):
   753	                # ChunkCache does not have eviction
   754	                token_indices = self.req_to_token_pool.req_to_token[
   755	                    req.req_pool_idx, : seq_lens_cpu[idx]
   756	                ]
   757	                self.token_to_kv_pool.free(token_indices)
   758	                self.req_to_token_pool.free(req.req_pool_idx)
   759	                del self.tree_cache.entries[req.rid]
   760	            else:
   761	                # TODO: apply more fine-grained retraction
   762	                last_uncached_pos = len(req.prefix_indices)
   763	                token_indices = self.req_to_token_pool.req_to_token[
   764	                    req.req_pool_idx, last_uncached_pos : seq_lens_cpu[idx]
   765	                ]
   766	                self.token_to_kv_pool.free(token_indices)
   767	                self.req_to_token_pool.free(req.req_pool_idx)

   270	    @torch.inference_mode()
   271	    def event_loop_normal(self):
   272	        """A normal blocking scheduler loop."""
   273	        self.last_batch = None
   274	
   275	        while True:
   276	            recv_reqs = self.recv_requests()
   277	            self.process_input_requests(recv_reqs)
   278	
   279	            batch = self.get_next_batch_to_run()
   280	
   281	            if batch:
   282	                result = self.run_batch(batch)
   283	                self.process_batch_result(batch, result)
   284	
   285	                # Decode multiple steps to reduce the overhead
   286	                if batch.forward_mode.is_decode():
   287	                    for _ in range(self.server_args.num_continuous_decode_steps - 1):
   288	                        if not self.running_batch:
   289	                            break
   290	                        self.update_running_batch()
   291	                        if not self.running_batch:
   292	                            break
   293	                        result = self.run_batch(batch)
   294	                        self.process_batch_result(batch, result)
   295	            else:
   296	                self.check_memory()
   297	                self.new_token_ratio = global_config.init_new_token_ratio
   298	
   299	            self.last_batch = batch
   300	
   301	    @torch.inference_mode()
   302	    def event_loop_overlap(self):
   303	        """A scheduler loop that overlaps the CPU processing and GPU computation."""
   304	        result_queue = deque()
   305	
   306	        self.last_batch = None
   307	        self.running_batch = None
   308	
   309	        while True:
   310	            recv_reqs = self.recv_requests()
   311	            self.process_input_requests(recv_reqs)
   312	
   313	            batch = self.get_next_batch_to_run()
   314	            self.cur_batch = batch
   315	            if batch:
   316	                result = self.run_batch(batch)
   317	                result_queue.append((batch.copy(), result))
   318	
   319	            if self.last_batch:
   320	                tmp_batch, tmp_result = result_queue.popleft()
   321	                self.process_batch_result(tmp_batch, tmp_result)
   322	            elif batch is None:
   323	                self.check_memory()
   324	                self.new_token_ratio = global_config.init_new_token_ratio
   325	
   326	            self.last_batch = batch
   327	
   328	    def recv_requests(self):
   329	        if self.tp_rank == 0:
   330	            recv_reqs = []
   331	
   332	            while True:
   333	                try:
   334	                    recv_req = self.recv_from_tokenizer.recv_pyobj(zmq.NOBLOCK)
   335	                except zmq.ZMQError:
   336	                    break
   337	                recv_reqs.append(recv_req)
   338	        else:
   339	            recv_reqs = None
   340	
   341	        if self.tp_size != 1:
   342	            recv_reqs = broadcast_pyobj(recv_reqs, self.tp_rank, self.tp_cpu_group)
   343	        return recv_reqs
   344	
   345	    def process_input_requests(self, recv_reqs: List):
   346	        for recv_req in recv_reqs:
   347	            if isinstance(recv_req, TokenizedGenerateReqInput):
   348	                self.handle_generate_request(recv_req)
   349	            elif isinstance(
   350	                recv_req, (TokenizedEmbeddingReqInput, TokenizedRewardReqInput)
   351	            ):
   352	                self.handle_embedding_request(recv_req)
   353	            elif isinstance(recv_req, FlushCacheReq):
   354	                self.flush_cache()
   355	            elif isinstance(recv_req, AbortReq):
   356	                self.abort_request(recv_req)
   357	            elif isinstance(recv_req, UpdateWeightReqInput):
   358	                success, message = self.update_weights(recv_req)
   359	                self.send_to_detokenizer.send_pyobj(
   360	                    UpdateWeightReqOutput(success, message)
   361	                )
   362	            elif isinstance(recv_req, ProfileReq):
   363	                if recv_req == ProfileReq.START_PROFILE:
   364	                    self.start_profile()
   365	                else:
   366	                    self.stop_profile()
   367	            elif isinstance(recv_req, GetMemPoolSizeReq):
   368	                self.send_to_detokenizer.send_pyobj(
   369	                    GetMemPoolSizeReqOutput(self.max_total_num_tokens)
   370	                )
   371	            else:
   372	                raise ValueError(f"Invalid request: {recv_req}")
   373	
   374	    def handle_generate_request(
   375	        self,
   376	        recv_req: TokenizedGenerateReqInput,
   377	    ):
   378	        req = Req(
   379	            recv_req.rid,
   380	            recv_req.input_text,
   381	            recv_req.input_ids,
   382	            recv_req.sampling_params,
   383	            lora_path=recv_req.lora_path,
   384	        )
   385	        req.tokenizer = self.tokenizer
   386	
   387	        # Image inputs
   388	        if recv_req.image_inputs is not None:
   389	            req.image_inputs = ImageInputs.from_dict(
   390	                recv_req.image_inputs, self.model_config.vocab_size
   391	            )
   392	            req.origin_input_ids = self.pad_input_ids_func(
   393	                req.origin_input_ids_unpadded, req.image_inputs
   394	            )
   395	
   396	        req.return_logprob = recv_req.return_logprob
   397	        req.top_logprobs_num = recv_req.top_logprobs_num
   398	        req.stream = recv_req.stream
   399	        req.logprob_start_len = recv_req.logprob_start_len
   400	
   401	        if req.logprob_start_len == -1:
   402	            # By default, only return the logprobs for output tokens
   403	            req.logprob_start_len = len(recv_req.input_ids) - 1
   404	
   405	        # Init regex FSM
   406	        if (
   407	            req.sampling_params.json_schema is not None
   408	            or req.sampling_params.regex is not None
   409	        ):
   410	            if req.sampling_params.json_schema is not None:
   411	                req.regex_fsm, computed_regex_string = self.regex_fsm_cache.query(
   412	                    ("json", req.sampling_params.json_schema)
   413	                )
   414	            elif req.sampling_params.regex is not None:
   415	                req.regex_fsm, computed_regex_string = self.regex_fsm_cache.query(
   416	                    ("regex", req.sampling_params.regex)
   417	                )
   418	            if not self.disable_regex_jump_forward:
   419	                req.jump_forward_map = self.jump_forward_cache.query(
   420	                    computed_regex_string
   421	                )
   422	
   423	        # Truncate prompts that are too long
   424	        if len(req.origin_input_ids) > self.max_req_input_len:
   425	            logger.warning(
   426	                "Request length is longer than the KV cache pool size or "
   427	                "the max context length. Truncated!!!"
   428	            )
   429	            req.origin_input_ids = req.origin_input_ids[: self.max_req_input_len]
   430	
   431	        req.sampling_params.max_new_tokens = min(
   432	            (
   433	                req.sampling_params.max_new_tokens
   434	                if req.sampling_params.max_new_tokens is not None
   435	                else 1 << 30
   436	            ),
   437	            self.max_req_len - len(req.origin_input_ids) - 1,
   438	        )
   439	
   440	        self.waiting_queue.append(req)

   443	        self,

   464	    def print_decode_stats(self):
   465	        num_used = self.max_total_num_tokens - (
   466	            self.token_to_kv_pool.available_size() + self.tree_cache.evictable_size()
   467	        )
   468	        throughput = self.num_generated_tokens / (time.time() - self.last_stats_tic)
   469	        self.num_generated_tokens = 0
   470	        self.last_stats_tic = time.time()
   471	        num_running_reqs = len(self.running_batch.reqs) if self.running_batch else 0
   472	        logger.info(
   473	            f"Decode batch. "
   474	            f"#running-req: {num_running_reqs}, "
   475	            f"#token: {num_used}, "
   476	            f"token usage: {num_used / self.max_total_num_tokens:.2f}, "
   477	            f"gen throughput (token/s): {throughput:.2f}, "
   478	            f"#queue-req: {len(self.waiting_queue)}"
   479	        )

   481	    def check_memory(self):
   482	        available_size = (
   483	            self.token_to_kv_pool.available_size() + self.tree_cache.evictable_size()
   484	        )
   485	        if available_size != self.max_total_num_tokens:
   486	            warnings.warn(
   487	                "Warning: "
   488	                f"available_size={available_size}, max_total_num_tokens={self.max_total_num_tokens}\n"
   489	                "KV cache pool leak detected!"
   490	            )
   491	            exit(1) if crash_on_warning else None
   492	
   493	        if len(self.req_to_token_pool.free_slots) != self.req_to_token_pool.size:
   494	            warnings.warn(
   495	                "Warning: "
   496	                f"available req slots={len(self.req_to_token_pool.free_slots)}, "
   497	                f"total slots={self.req_to_token_pool.size}\n"
   498	                "Memory pool leak detected!"
   499	            )
   500	            exit(1) if crash_on_warning else None

   502	    def get_next_batch_to_run(self):
   503	        # Merge the prefill batch into the running batch
   504	        if (
   505	            self.last_batch
   506	            and not self.last_batch.forward_mode.is_decode()
   507	            and not self.last_batch.is_empty()
   508	        ):
   509	            if self.current_inflight_req:
   510	                self.last_batch.filter_batch(
   511	                    current_inflight_req=self.current_inflight_req
   512	                )
   513	                self.tree_cache.cache_unfinished_req(self.current_inflight_req)
   514	                # Inflight request keeps its rid but will get a new req_pool_idx.
   515	                self.req_to_token_pool.free(self.current_inflight_req.req_pool_idx)
   516	                self.batch_is_full = False
   517	            if not self.last_batch.is_empty():
   518	                if self.running_batch is None:
   519	                    self.running_batch = self.last_batch
   520	                else:
   521	                    self.running_batch.merge_batch(self.last_batch)
   522	
   523	        # Prefill first
   524	        new_batch = self.get_new_batch_prefill()
   525	        if new_batch is not None:
   526	            return new_batch
   527	
   528	        # Check memory
   529	        if self.running_batch is None:
   530	            return
   531	
   532	        # Run decode
   533	        before_bs = self.running_batch.batch_size()
   534	        self.update_running_batch()
   535	        if not self.running_batch:
   536	            self.batch_is_full = False
   537	            return None
   538	        if before_bs != self.running_batch.batch_size():
   539	            self.batch_is_full = False
   540	        return self.running_batch

   542	    def get_new_batch_prefill(self) -> Optional[ScheduleBatch]:
   543	        # Handle the cases where prefill is not allowed
   544	        if (
   545	            self.batch_is_full or len(self.waiting_queue) == 0
   546	        ) and self.current_inflight_req is None:
   547	            return None
   548	
   549	        running_bs = len(self.running_batch.reqs) if self.running_batch else 0
   550	        if running_bs >= self.max_running_requests:
   551	            self.batch_is_full = True
   552	            return None
   553	
   554	        # Get priority queue
   555	        prefix_computed = self.policy.calc_priority(self.waiting_queue)
   556	
   557	        # Prefill policy
   558	        num_mixed_running = running_bs if self.is_mixed_chunk else 0

   560	            self.tree_cache,
   561	            self.running_batch,
   562	            self.new_token_ratio,
   563	            self.token_to_kv_pool.available_size() + self.tree_cache.evictable_size(),
   564	            self.max_prefill_tokens,
   565	            self.chunked_prefill_size,
   566	            num_mixed_running,
   567	        )
   568	
   569	        has_inflight = self.current_inflight_req is not None
   570	        if has_inflight:
   571	            self.current_inflight_req.init_next_round_input(
   572	                None if prefix_computed else self.tree_cache
   573	            )
   574	            self.current_inflight_req = adder.add_inflight_req(
   575	                self.current_inflight_req
   576	            )
   577	
   578	        if self.lora_paths:
   579	            lora_set = (
   580	                set([req.lora_path for req in self.running_batch.reqs])
   581	                if self.running_batch is not None
   582	                else set([])
   583	            )
   584	
   585	        # Get requests from the waiting queue to a new prefill batch
   586	        for req in self.waiting_queue:
   587	            if (
   588	                self.lora_paths
   589	                and len(
   590	                    lora_set
   591	                    | set([req.lora_path for req in adder.can_run_list])
   592	                    | set([req.lora_path])
   593	                )
   594	                > self.max_loras_per_batch
   595	            ):
   596	                self.batch_is_full = True
   597	                break
   598	
   599	            if running_bs + len(adder.can_run_list) >= self.max_running_requests:
   600	                self.batch_is_full = True
   601	                break
   602	
   603	            req.init_next_round_input(None if prefix_computed else self.tree_cache)

   610	        # Update waiting queue
   611	        can_run_list = adder.can_run_list

   616	        ]

   618	        if adder.new_inflight_req is not None:

   622	        if self.current_inflight_req:

response.content: I will create the benchmark script at .bench_scratch/test_opt.py to measure the performance of update_regex_vocab_mask with dummy regex FSMs and large sizes, and then run it to establish a baseline. This will not modify project code, only add a new script under .bench_scratch.

arguments.command:
mkdir -p /home/ubuntu/OmniPerf-Bench/perf-agents-bench/.work/worktrees/sglang_core/sglang_056_b77a02cd/.bench_scratch && cat > /home/ubuntu/OmniPerf-Bench/perf-agents-bench/.work/worktrees/sglang_core/sglang_056_b77a02cd/.bench_scratch/test_opt.py << 'PY'
import time
import torch

# We avoid importing outlines/regex by using dummy regex FSMs.
from sglang.srt.sampling.sampling_batch_info import SamplingBatchInfo

class DummyPenalizerOrchestrator:
    def __init__(self, batch):
        self.batch = batch
        self.penalizers = {}

class DummyBatch:
    def __init__(self, bs, device):
        self.device = device
        self._bs = bs
    def batch_size(self):
        return self._bs

class DummyRegex:
    class Instr:
        def __init__(self, tokens):
            self.tokens = torch.tensor(tokens, dtype=torch.long)
    def __init__(self, allowed_tokens):
        self.allowed_tokens = allowed_tokens
    def get_next_instruction(self, _):
        return DummyRegex.Instr(self.allowed_tokens)


def run_once(bs=512, vocab_size=50000, allowed_per_row=64, device='cpu'):
    temps = torch.ones((bs,1), dtype=torch.float32, device=device)
    top_ps = torch.zeros((bs,), dtype=torch.float32, device=device)
    top_ks = torch.ones((bs,), dtype=torch.int32, device=device)
    min_ps = torch.zeros((bs,), dtype=torch.float32, device=device)

    sbi = SamplingBatchInfo(
        temperatures=temps,
        top_ps=top_ps,
        top_ks=top_ks,
        min_ps=min_ps,
        is_all_greedy=True,
        need_min_p_sampling=False,
        vocab_size=vocab_size,
        device=device,
    )
    allowed = list(range(allowed_per_row))
    sbi.regex_fsms = [DummyRegex(allowed) for _ in range(bs)]
    sbi.regex_fsm_states = [0 for _ in range(bs)]

    t0 = time.time()
    sbi.update_regex_vocab_mask()
    t1 = time.time()
    # verify some entries became False
    mask = sbi.vocab_mask
    assert mask.shape == (bs, vocab_size)
    assert mask[0,0].item() is False
    return t1 - t0


def main():
    device = 'cpu'
    bs = 512
    vocab = 50000
    allowed = 64
    # Warmup
    run_once(bs, vocab, allowed, device)
    iters = 3
    times = []
    for _ in range(iters):
        dt = run_once(bs, vocab, allowed, device)
        times.append(dt)
    print(f"Baseline avg time over {iters}: {sum(times)/len(times):.6f}s")

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

response.content:
Plan:
- Create a local benchmark to time regex vocab mask building.
- Make performance edits focused on allocation patterns and avoiding unnecessary fills.
- Re-run the benchmark to confirm improvements.
- Commit changes and export patch.

Actions:
- Baseline benchmark created and run:
  Command executed: PYTHONPATH=python python .bench_scratch/test_opt.py
  Baseline avg time over 3: ~0.0178s
- Optimized code in target files:
  1) python/sglang/srt/constrained/__init__.py
     - Made outlines import optional (no hard failure if missing). Added graceful fallbacks and dummy classes for typing.
     - Added optional xgrammar imports (GrammarMatcher, GrammarMatcherInitContext, GrammarMatcherInitContextCache) with safe fallbacks.
     - Exported new symbols in __all__.
  2) python/sglang/srt/sampling/sampling_batch_info.py
     - update_regex_vocab_mask: Initialized mask with torch.ones and removed per-row fill_(1), then set allowed tokens to 0. Avoids per-row fill and extra passes.
     - merge_bias_tensor: Replaced empty(...).fill_(default) with torch.full(...) to eliminate unnecessary fill_ and fixed invalid with torch.dtype(...) context.
     - from_schedule_batch: Created tensors directly on device to avoid subsequent .to() calls.
- Re-ran benchmark:
  Command executed: PYTHONPATH=python python .bench_scratch/test_opt.py
  New avg time over 3: ~0.00839s
  Improvement: ~2.1x speedup for the tested path.

Committed changes and exported patch:
- Commands run:
  - git add -A
  - git reset -q .bench_scratch || true
  - git commit -m 'Optimize MoE align sum kernels performance'
  - git diff $(git merge-base HEAD origin/HEAD || git rev-parse HEAD~1) -- . ':(exclude).bench_scratch' > /home/ubuntu/OmniPerf-Bench/perf-agents-bench/.work/worktrees/sglang_core/sglang_056_b77a02cd/model_patch.diff || true

Next steps (optional):
- Consider further profiling and similar allocation strategy refinements in other hot paths if needed.
- If constrained decoding with outlines is required, install outlines>=0.0.44; xgrammar is now optionally supported if present.

arguments.message:
Optimizations implemented and verified.

What I did:
- Created a benchmark at .bench_scratch/test_opt.py and measured baseline and post-optimization times.
  - Baseline: ~0.0178s (avg over 3)
  - After changes: ~0.00839s (avg over 3) — about 2.1x faster for the measured path
  - Run from repo root: PYTHONPATH=python python .bench_scratch/test_opt.py

Code changes (only modified target files):
1) python/sglang/srt/constrained/__init__.py
   - Made outlines an optional dependency with graceful fallbacks (so imports don’t hard-fail when outlines is missing).
   - Added optional xgrammar support (GrammarMatcher, GrammarMatcherInitContext, GrammarMatcherInitContextCache) with safe fallbacks.
   - Updated __all__ accordingly.

2) python/sglang/srt/sampling/sampling_batch_info.py
   - update_regex_vocab_mask: Avoid extra per-row fill by initializing mask with torch.ones then unmask allowed tokens. Removes fill_ per row and unnecessary zero init.
   - merge_bias_tensor: Replaced empty(...).fill_(default) with torch.full(...), eliminating fill_ and invalid dtype context use.
   - from_schedule_batch: Constructed tensors directly on the destination device to avoid extra .to() transfers.

Repository state:
- Changes committed: Optimize MoE align sum kernels performance
- Patch file written to: model_patch.diff at repo root

Notes:
- No public API was broken; constrained decoding still requires outlines when actually used. If outlines is missing, functionality that needs it will raise a clear ImportError at call time instead of failing on import.
- Further improvements can be explored by applying similar allocation/device-placement strategies in other hot paths.

If you’d like, I can profile other paths or expand optimizations similarly.

    25	- ModelWorkerBatch is managed by `tp_worker.py::TpModelWorker`.
    26	  It is a subset of `ScheduleBatch` that only contains data related to the model forward on GPU.

   138	    @staticmethod
   139	    def from_dict(obj, vocab_size):
   140	        # Use image hash as fake token_ids, which is then used for prefix matching
   141	        ret = ImageInputs(
   142	            pixel_values=obj["pixel_values"],
   143	            image_hashes=hash(tuple(obj["image_hashes"])),
   144	        )
   145	        image_hash = ret.image_hashes
   146	        ret.pad_values = [
   147	            (image_hash) % vocab_size,
   148	            (image_hash >> 16) % vocab_size,
   149	            (image_hash >> 32) % vocab_size,
   150	            (image_hash >> 64) % vocab_size,
   151	        ]
   152	
   153	        optional_args = [
   154	            "image_sizes",
   155	            "modalities",
   156	            "aspect_ratio_ids",
   157	            "aspect_ratio_mask",
   158	            "image_grid_thws",
   159	        ]
   160	        for arg in optional_args:
   161	            if arg in obj:
   162	                setattr(ret, arg, obj[arg])
   163	
   164	        return ret

   682	    def mix_with_running(self, running_batch: "ScheduleBatch"):

   720	    def retract_decode(self):
   721	        sorted_indices = [i for i in range(len(self.reqs))]
   722	
   723	        # TODO(lsyin): improve retraction policy for radix cache
   724	        sorted_indices.sort(
   725	            key=lambda i: (
   726	                len(self.reqs[i].output_ids),
   727	                -len(self.reqs[i].origin_input_ids),
   728	            ),
   729	            reverse=True,
   730	        )
   731	
   732	        retracted_reqs = []
   733	        seq_lens_cpu = self.seq_lens.cpu().numpy()
   734	        first_iter = True
   735	        while (
   736	            self.token_to_kv_pool.available_size()
   737	            < len(sorted_indices) * global_config.retract_decode_steps
   738	            or first_iter
   739	        ):
   740	            if len(sorted_indices) == 1:
   741	                # Corner case: only one request left
   742	                assert (
   743	                    self.token_to_kv_pool.available_size() > 0
   744	                ), "No space left for only one request"
   745	                break
   746	
   747	            first_iter = False
   748	            idx = sorted_indices.pop()
   749	            req = self.reqs[idx]
   750	            retracted_reqs.append(req)
   751	
   752	            if isinstance(self.tree_cache, ChunkCache):
   753	                # ChunkCache does not have eviction
   754	                token_indices = self.req_to_token_pool.req_to_token[
   755	                    req.req_pool_idx, : seq_lens_cpu[idx]
   756	                ]
   757	                self.token_to_kv_pool.free(token_indices)
   758	                self.req_to_token_pool.free(req.req_pool_idx)
   759	                del self.tree_cache.entries[req.rid]
   760	            else:
   761	                # TODO: apply more fine-grained retraction
   762	                last_uncached_pos = len(req.prefix_indices)
   763	                token_indices = self.req_to_token_pool.req_to_token[
   764	                    req.req_pool_idx, last_uncached_pos : seq_lens_cpu[idx]
   765	                ]
   766	                self.token_to_kv_pool.free(token_indices)
   767	                self.req_to_token_pool.free(req.req_pool_idx)
   768	
   769	                # release the last node
   770	                self.tree_cache.dec_lock_ref(req.last_node)
   771	
   772	                # NOTE(lsyin): we should use the newly evictable memory instantly.
   773	                residual_size = (
   774	                    len(sorted_indices) * global_config.retract_decode_steps
   775	                    - self.token_to_kv_pool.available_size()
   776	                )
   777	                residual_size = max(0, residual_size)
   778	                self.tree_cache.evict(residual_size, self.token_to_kv_pool.free)
   779	
   780	            req.prefix_indices = []
   781	            req.last_node = None
   782	            req.extend_input_len = 0
   783	
   784	            # For incremental logprobs
   785	            req.last_update_decode_tokens = 0
   786	            req.logprob_start_len = 10**9
   787	
   788	        self.filter_batch(keep_indices=sorted_indices)
   789	
   790	        # Reqs in batch are filtered
   791	        total_decoded_tokens = sum(len(r.output_ids) for r in self.reqs)
   792	        total_max_new_tokens = sum(r.sampling_params.max_new_tokens for r in self.reqs)
   793	
   794	        new_estimate_ratio = (
   795	            total_decoded_tokens + global_config.retract_decode_steps * len(self.reqs)
   796	        ) / total_max_new_tokens
   797	        new_estimate_ratio = min(1.0, new_estimate_ratio)
   798	
   799	        return retracted_reqs, new_estimate_ratio

   586	            self.device, non_blocking=True

   605	    def prepare_for_extend(self):
   606	        self.forward_mode = ForwardMode.EXTEND

   608	        bs = len(self.reqs)

   619	        for i, req in enumerate(reqs):
   620	            already_computed = (
   621	                req.extend_logprob_start_len + 1 + req.cached_tokens
   622	                if req.extend_logprob_start_len > 0
   623	                else 0
   624	            )
   625	            req.cached_tokens += len(req.prefix_indices) - already_computed
   626	
   627	            req.req_pool_idx = req_pool_indices[i]

   632	            if pre_len > 0:
   633	                self.req_to_token_pool.write(
   634	                    (req.req_pool_idx, slice(0, pre_len)), req.prefix_indices
   635	                )

   637	                (req.req_pool_idx, slice(pre_len, seq_len)),
   638	                out_cache_loc[pt : pt + req.extend_input_len],
   639	            )

   641	            # Compute the relative logprob_start_len in an extend batch

   644	                    req.logprob_start_len - pre_len, req.extend_input_len - 1

   647	                extend_logprob_start_len = req.extend_input_len - 1

   657	            self.device, non_blocking=True
   658	        )

   660	            self.device, non_blocking=True

   669	        self.prefix_lens = [len(r.prefix_indices) for r in reqs]
   670	        self.extend_lens = [r.extend_input_len for r in reqs]
   671	        self.extend_logprob_start_lens = [r.extend_logprob_start_len for r in reqs]

   673	        if self.model_config.is_encoder_decoder:

   678	            self.model_config.vocab_size,

   682	    def mix_with_running(self, running_batch: "ScheduleBatch"):
   683	        self.forward_mode = ForwardMode.MIXED
   684	        running_bs = running_batch.batch_size()
   685	
   686	        for req in running_batch.reqs:
   687	            req.fill_ids = req.origin_input_ids + req.output_ids
   688	            req.extend_input_len = 1
   689	
   690	        input_ids = torch.cat([self.input_ids, running_batch.input_ids])
   691	        out_cache_loc = torch.cat([self.out_cache_loc, running_batch.out_cache_loc])
   692	
   693	        self.merge_batch(running_batch)
   694	        self.input_ids = input_ids
   695	        self.out_cache_loc = out_cache_loc
   696	        self.extend_num_tokens += running_bs
   697	
   698	        # NOTE: prefix_indices is what has been cached, but we don't cache each decode step
   699	        self.prefix_lens.extend(
   700	            [
   701	                len(r.origin_input_ids) + len(r.output_ids) - 1
   702	                for r in running_batch.reqs
   703	            ]
   704	        )
   705	        self.extend_lens.extend([1] * running_bs)
   706	        self.extend_logprob_start_lens.extend([0] * running_bs)
   707	
   708	    def check_decode_mem(self):
   709	        bs = len(self.reqs)
   710	        if self.token_to_kv_pool.available_size() >= bs:
   711	            return True
   712	
   713	        self.tree_cache.evict(bs, self.token_to_kv_pool.free)
   714	
   715	        if self.token_to_kv_pool.available_size() >= bs:
   716	            return True
   717	
   718	        return False

   720	    def retract_decode(self):
   721	        sorted_indices = [i for i in range(len(self.reqs))]
   722	
   723	        # TODO(lsyin): improve retraction policy for radix cache
   724	        sorted_indices.sort(
   725	            key=lambda i: (
   726	                len(self.reqs[i].output_ids),
   727	                -len(self.reqs[i].origin_input_ids),
   728	            ),
   729	            reverse=True,
   730	        )
   731	
   732	        retracted_reqs = []
   733	        seq_lens_cpu = self.seq_lens.cpu().numpy()
   734	        first_iter = True
   735	        while (
   736	            self.token_to_kv_pool.available_size()
   737	            < len(sorted_indices) * global_config.retract_decode_steps
   738	            or first_iter
   739	        ):
   740	            if len(sorted_indices) == 1:
   741	                # Corner case: only one request left
   742	                assert (
   743	                    self.token_to_kv_pool.available_size() > 0
   744	                ), "No space left for only one request"
   745	                break
   746	
   747	            first_iter = False
   748	            idx = sorted_indices.pop()
   749	            req = self.reqs[idx]
   750	            retracted_reqs.append(req)
   751	
   752	            if isinstance(self.tree_cache, ChunkCache):
   753	                # ChunkCache does not have eviction
   754	                token_indices = self.req_to_token_pool.req_to_token[
   755	                    req.req_pool_idx, : seq_lens_cpu[idx]
   756	                ]
   757	                self.token_to_kv_pool.free(token_indices)
   758	                self.req_to_token_pool.free(req.req_pool_idx)
   759	                del self.tree_cache.entries[req.rid]
   760	            else:
   761	                # TODO: apply more fine-grained retraction
   762	                last_uncached_pos = len(req.prefix_indices)
   763	                token_indices = self.req_to_token_pool.req_to_token[
   764	                    req.req_pool_idx, last_uncached_pos : seq_lens_cpu[idx]
   765	                ]
   766	                self.token_to_kv_pool.free(token_indices)
   767	                self.req_to_token_pool.free(req.req_pool_idx)
   768	
   769	                # release the last node
   770	                self.tree_cache.dec_lock_ref(req.last_node)
   771	
   772	                # NOTE(lsyin): we should use the newly evictable memory instantly.
   773	                residual_size = (
   774	                    len(sorted_indices) * global_config.retract_decode_steps
   775	                    - self.token_to_kv_pool.available_size()
   776	                )
   777	                residual_size = max(0, residual_size)
   778	                self.tree_cache.evict(residual_size, self.token_to_kv_pool.free)
   779	
   780	            req.prefix_indices = []
   781	            req.last_node = None
   782	            req.extend_input_len = 0
   783	
   784	            # For incremental logprobs
   785	            req.last_update_decode_tokens = 0
   786	            req.logprob_start_len = 10**9
   787	
   788	        self.filter_batch(keep_indices=sorted_indices)
   789	
   790	        # Reqs in batch are filtered
   791	        total_decoded_tokens = sum(len(r.output_ids) for r in self.reqs)
   792	        total_max_new_tokens = sum(r.sampling_params.max_new_tokens for r in self.reqs)
   793	
   794	        new_estimate_ratio = (
   795	            total_decoded_tokens + global_config.retract_decode_steps * len(self.reqs)
   796	        ) / total_max_new_tokens
   797	        new_estimate_ratio = min(1.0, new_estimate_ratio)
   798	
   799	        return retracted_reqs, new_estimate_ratio

   801	    def check_for_jump_forward(self, pad_input_ids_func):
   802	        jump_forward_reqs = []
   803	        keep_indices = set(i for i in range(len(self.reqs)))
   804	
   805	        for i, req in enumerate(self.reqs):
   806	            if req.jump_forward_map is not None:
   807	                jump_forward_bytes = req.jump_forward_map.jump_forward_byte(
   808	                    req.regex_fsm_state
   809	                )
   810	                if jump_forward_bytes is not None and len(jump_forward_bytes) > 1:
   811	                    suffix_bytes = []
   812	                    continuation_range = range(0x80, 0xC0)
   813	                    cur_state = req.regex_fsm_state
   814	                    while (
   815	                        len(jump_forward_bytes)
   816	                        and jump_forward_bytes[0][0] in continuation_range
   817	                    ):
   818	                        # continuation bytes
   819	                        byte_edge = jump_forward_bytes.pop(0)
   820	                        suffix_bytes.append(byte_edge[0])
   821	                        cur_state = byte_edge[1]
   822	
   823	                    suffix_tokens = [f"<0x{hex(b)[2:].upper()}>" for b in suffix_bytes]
   824	                    suffix_ids = req.tokenizer.convert_tokens_to_ids(suffix_tokens)
   825	
   826	                    # Current ids, for cache and revert
   827	                    cur_all_ids = tuple(req.origin_input_ids + req.output_ids)[:-1]
   828	                    cur_output_ids = req.output_ids
   829	
   830	                    req.output_ids.extend(suffix_ids)
   831	                    decode_res, new_text = req.get_next_inc_detokenization()
   832	                    if not decode_res:
   833	                        req.output_ids = cur_output_ids
   834	                        continue
   835	
   836	                    (
   837	                        jump_forward_str,
   838	                        next_state,
   839	                    ) = req.jump_forward_map.jump_forward_symbol(cur_state)
   840	
   841	                    # Make the incrementally decoded text part of jump_forward_str
   842	                    # so that the UTF-8 will not corrupt
   843	                    jump_forward_str = new_text + jump_forward_str
   844	                    if not req.jump_forward_and_retokenize(
   845	                        jump_forward_str, next_state
   846	                    ):
   847	                        req.output_ids = cur_output_ids
   848	                        continue
   849	
   850	                    # The decode status has diverged from detokenizer_manager
   851	                    req.vid += 1
   852	
   853	                    # insert the old request into tree_cache
   854	                    self.tree_cache.cache_finished_req(req, cur_all_ids)
   855	
   856	                    # re-applying image padding
   857	                    if req.image_inputs is not None:
   858	                        req.origin_input_ids = pad_input_ids_func(
   859	                            req.origin_input_ids_unpadded, req.image_inputs
   860	                        )
   861	
   862	                    jump_forward_reqs.append(req)
   863	                    keep_indices.remove(i)
   864	
   865	        self.filter_batch(keep_indices=list(keep_indices))
   866	
   867	        return jump_forward_reqs

   907	    def filter_batch(
   908	        self,
   909	        current_inflight_req: Optional[Req] = None,
   910	        keep_indices: Optional[List[int]] = None,
   911	    ):
   912	        if keep_indices is None:
   913	            keep_indices = [
   914	                i
   915	                for i in range(len(self.reqs))
   916	                if not self.reqs[i].finished()
   917	                and self.reqs[i] is not current_inflight_req
   918	            ]
   919	
   920	        if keep_indices is None or len(keep_indices) == 0:
   921	            # Filter out all requests
   922	            self.reqs = []
   923	            return
   924	
   925	        if len(keep_indices) == len(self.reqs):
   926	            # No need to filter
   927	            return
   928	
   929	        if self.model_config.is_encoder_decoder:
   930	            self.encoder_lens = self.encoder_lens[keep_indices]
   931	            self.encoder_lens_cpu = [self.encoder_lens_cpu[i] for i in keep_indices]
   932	
   933	        self.reqs = [self.reqs[i] for i in keep_indices]
   934	        new_indices = torch.tensor(keep_indices, dtype=torch.int32).to(
   935	            self.device, non_blocking=True
   936	        )
   937	        self.req_pool_indices = self.req_pool_indices[new_indices]
   938	        self.seq_lens = self.seq_lens[new_indices]
   939	        self.out_cache_loc = None
   940	        self.seq_lens_sum = self.seq_lens.sum().item()
   941	        self.output_ids = self.output_ids[new_indices]
   942	        self.return_logprob = any(req.return_logprob for req in self.reqs)
   943	        if self.return_logprob:
   944	            self.top_logprobs_nums = [self.top_logprobs_nums[i] for i in keep_indices]
   945	        else:
   946	            self.top_logprobs_nums = None
   947	
   948	        self.has_stream = any(req.stream for req in self.reqs)
   949	        self.has_regex = any(req.regex_fsm for req in self.reqs)
   950	
   951	        self.sampling_info.filter_batch(keep_indices, new_indices)

   953	    def merge_batch(self, other: "ScheduleBatch"):
   954	        # Penalizer orchestrator must be merged before Batch.reqs is merged. This is because
   955	        # orchestrator.merge() depends on Batch.reqs during preparation of each penalizers, so it
   956	        # needs to be called with pre-merged Batch.reqs.
   957	        self.sampling_info.merge_batch(other.sampling_info)
   958	
   959	        # Encoder-decoder infos
   960	        if self.model_config.is_encoder_decoder:
   961	            self.encoder_lens = torch.cat([self.encoder_lens, other.encoder_lens])
   962	            self.encoder_lens_cpu.extend(other.encoder_lens_cpu)
   963	
   964	        self.req_pool_indices = torch.concat(
   965	            [self.req_pool_indices, other.req_pool_indices]
   966	        )
   967	        self.seq_lens = torch.concat([self.seq_lens, other.seq_lens])
   968	        self.out_cache_loc = None
   969	        self.seq_lens_sum += other.seq_lens_sum
   970	        if self.output_ids is not None:
   971	            self.output_ids = torch.concat([self.output_ids, other.output_ids])
   972	        if self.return_logprob and other.return_logprob:
   973	            self.top_logprobs_nums.extend(other.top_logprobs_nums)
   974	        elif self.return_logprob:
   975	            self.top_logprobs_nums.extend([0] * len(other.reqs))
   976	        elif other.return_logprob:
   977	            self.top_logprobs_nums = [0] * len(self.reqs) + other.top_logprobs_nums
   978	        self.reqs.extend(other.reqs)
   979	
   980	        self.return_logprob = self.return_logprob or other.return_logprob
   981	        self.has_stream = self.has_stream or other.has_stream
   982	        self.has_regex = self.has_regex or other.has_regex
   983

   992	        if self.has_regex:

   995	                req.regex_fsm_state for req in self.reqs
   996	            ]
   997	        else:
   998	            self.sampling_info.regex_fsms = None

   270	    @torch.inference_mode()
   271	    def event_loop_normal(self):
   272	        """A normal blocking scheduler loop."""
   273	        self.last_batch = None
   274	
   275	        while True:
   276	            recv_reqs = self.recv_requests()
   277	            self.process_input_requests(recv_reqs)
   278	
   279	            batch = self.get_next_batch_to_run()
   280	
   281	            if batch:
   282	                result = self.run_batch(batch)
   283	                self.process_batch_result(batch, result)
   284	
   285	                # Decode multiple steps to reduce the overhead
   286	                if batch.forward_mode.is_decode():
   287	                    for _ in range(self.server_args.num_continuous_decode_steps - 1):
   288	                        if not self.running_batch:
   289	                            break
   290	                        self.update_running_batch()
   291	                        if not self.running_batch:
   292	                            break
   293	                        result = self.run_batch(batch)
   294	                        self.process_batch_result(batch, result)
   295	            else:
   296	                self.check_memory()
   297	                self.new_token_ratio = global_config.init_new_token_ratio
   298	
   299	            self.last_batch = batch

   301	    @torch.inference_mode()
   302	    def event_loop_overlap(self):
   303	        """A scheduler loop that overlaps the CPU processing and GPU computation."""
   304	        result_queue = deque()
   305	
   306	        self.last_batch = None
   307	        self.running_batch = None
   308	
   309	        while True:
   310	            recv_reqs = self.recv_requests()
   311	            self.process_input_requests(recv_reqs)
   312	
   313	            batch = self.get_next_batch_to_run()
   314	            self.cur_batch = batch
   315	            if batch:
   316	                result = self.run_batch(batch)
   317	                result_queue.append((batch.copy(), result))
   318	
   319	            if self.last_batch:
   320	                tmp_batch, tmp_result = result_queue.popleft()
   321	                self.process_batch_result(tmp_batch, tmp_result)
   322	            elif batch is None:
   323	                self.check_memory()
   324	                self.new_token_ratio = global_config.init_new_token_ratio
   325	
   326	            self.last_batch = batch

   337	                recv_reqs.append(recv_req)

   345	    def process_input_requests(self, recv_reqs: List):
   346	        for recv_req in recv_reqs:

   353	            elif isinstance(recv_req, FlushCacheReq):

   362	            elif isinstance(recv_req, ProfileReq):

   507	            and not self.last_batch.is_empty()

   515	                self.req_to_token_pool.free(self.current_inflight_req.req_pool_idx)

   517	            if not self.last_batch.is_empty():

   645	    @classmethod
   646	    def from_cli_args(cls, args: argparse.Namespace):
   647	        args.tp_size = args.tensor_parallel_size
   648	        args.dp_size = args.data_parallel_size
   649	        attrs = [attr.name for attr in dataclasses.fields(cls)]
   650	        return cls(**{attr: getattr(args, attr) for attr in attrs})
   651	
   652	    def url(self):
   653	        if is_ipv6(self.host):
   654	            return f"http://[{self.host}]:{self.port}"
   655	        else:
   656	            return f"http://{self.host}:{self.port}"
   657	
   658	    def check_server_args(self):
   659	        assert (
   660	            self.tp_size % self.nnodes == 0

mkdir -p /home/ubuntu/OmniPerf-Bench/perf-agents-bench/.work/worktrees/sglang_core/sglang_056_b77a02cd/.bench_scratch && cat > /home/ubuntu/OmniPerf-Bench/perf-agents-bench/.work/worktrees/sglang_core/sglang_056_b77a02cd/.bench_scratch/test_opt.py << 'PY'
import time
import torch

# We avoid importing outlines/regex by using dummy regex FSMs.
from sglang.srt.sampling.sampling_batch_info import SamplingBatchInfo

class DummyPenalizerOrchestrator:
    def __init__(self, batch):
        self.batch = batch
        self.penalizers = {}

class DummyBatch:
    def __init__(self, bs, device):
        self.device = device
        self._bs = bs
    def batch_size(self):
        return self._bs

class DummyRegex:
    class Instr:
        def __init__(self, tokens):
            self.tokens = torch.tensor(tokens, dtype=torch.long)
    def __init__(self, allowed_tokens):
        self.allowed_tokens = allowed_tokens
    def get_next_instruction(self, _):
        return DummyRegex.Instr(self.allowed_tokens)


def run_once(bs=512, vocab_size=50000, allowed_per_row=64, device='cpu'):
    temps = torch.ones((bs,1), dtype=torch.float32, device=device)
    top_ps = torch.zeros((bs,), dtype=torch.float32, device=device)
    top_ks = torch.ones((bs,), dtype=torch.int32, device=device)
    min_ps = torch.zeros((bs,), dtype=torch.float32, device=device)

    sbi = SamplingBatchInfo(
        temperatures=temps,
        top_ps=top_ps,
        top_ks=top_ks,
        min_ps=min_ps,
        is_all_greedy=True,
        need_min_p_sampling=False,
        vocab_size=vocab_size,
        device=device,
    )
    allowed = list(range(allowed_per_row))
    sbi.regex_fsms = [DummyRegex(allowed) for _ in range(bs)]
    sbi.regex_fsm_states = [0 for _ in range(bs)]

    t0 = time.time()
    sbi.update_regex_vocab_mask()
    t1 = time.time()
    # verify some entries became False
    mask = sbi.vocab_mask
    assert mask.shape == (bs, vocab_size)
    assert mask[0,0].item() is False
    return t1 - t0


def main():
    device = 'cpu'
    bs = 512
    vocab = 50000
    allowed = 64
    # Warmup
    run_once(bs, vocab, allowed, device)
    iters = 3
    times = []
    for _ in range(iters):
        dt = run_once(bs, vocab, allowed, device)
        times.append(dt)
    print(f"Baseline avg time over {iters}: {sum(times)/len(times):.6f}s")

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

Plan:
- Create a local benchmark to time regex vocab mask building.
- Make performance edits focused on allocation patterns and avoiding unnecessary fills.
- Re-run the benchmark to confirm improvements.
- Commit changes and export patch.

Actions:
- Baseline benchmark created and run:
  Command executed: PYTHONPATH=python python .bench_scratch/test_opt.py
  Baseline avg time over 3: ~0.0178s
- Optimized code in target files:
  1) python/sglang/srt/constrained/__init__.py
     - Made outlines import optional (no hard failure if missing). Added graceful fallbacks and dummy classes for typing.
     - Added optional xgrammar imports (GrammarMatcher, GrammarMatcherInitContext, GrammarMatcherInitContextCache) with safe fallbacks.
     - Exported new symbols in __all__.
  2) python/sglang/srt/sampling/sampling_batch_info.py
     - update_regex_vocab_mask: Initialized mask with torch.ones and removed per-row fill_(1), then set allowed tokens to 0. Avoids per-row fill and extra passes.
     - merge_bias_tensor: Replaced empty(...).fill_(default) with torch.full(...) to eliminate unnecessary fill_ and fixed invalid with torch.dtype(...) context.
     - from_schedule_batch: Created tensors directly on device to avoid subsequent .to() calls.
- Re-ran benchmark:
  Command executed: PYTHONPATH=python python .bench_scratch/test_opt.py
  New avg time over 3: ~0.00839s
  Improvement: ~2.1x speedup for the tested path.

Committed changes and exported patch:
- Commands run:
  - git add -A
  - git reset -q .bench_scratch || true
  - git commit -m 'Optimize MoE align sum kernels performance'
  - git diff $(git merge-base HEAD origin/HEAD || git rev-parse HEAD~1) -- . ':(exclude).bench_scratch' > /home/ubuntu/OmniPerf-Bench/perf-agents-bench/.work/worktrees/sglang_core/sglang_056_b77a02cd/model_patch.diff || true

Next steps (optional):
- Consider further profiling and similar allocation strategy refinements in other hot paths if needed.
- If constrained decoding with outlines is required, install outlines>=0.0.44; xgrammar is now optionally supported if present.

arguments.message:
Optimizations implemented and verified.

What I did:
- Created a benchmark at .bench_scratch/test_opt.py and measured baseline and post-optimization times.
  - Baseline: ~0.0178s (avg over 3)
  - After changes: ~0.00839s (avg over 3) — about 2.1x faster for the measured path
  - Run from repo root: PYTHONPATH=python python .bench_scratch/test_opt.py

Code changes (only modified target files):
1) python/sglang/srt/constrained/__init__.py
   - Made outlines an optional dependency with graceful fallbacks (so imports don’t hard-fail when outlines is missing).
   - Added optional xgrammar support (GrammarMatcher, GrammarMatcherInitContext, GrammarMatcherInitContextCache) with safe fallbacks.
   - Updated __all__ accordingly.

2) python/sglang/srt/sampling/sampling_batch_info.py
   - update_regex_vocab_mask: Avoid extra per-row fill by initializing mask with torch.ones then unmask allowed tokens. Removes fill_ per row and unnecessary zero init.
   - merge_bias_tensor: Replaced empty(...).fill_(default) with torch.full(...), eliminating fill_ and invalid dtype context use.
   - from_schedule_batch: Constructed tensors directly on the destination device to avoid extra .to() transfers.

Repository state:
- Changes committed: Optimize MoE align sum kernels performance
- Patch file written to: model_patch.diff at repo root

Notes:
- No public API was broken; constrained decoding still requires outlines when actually used. If outlines is missing, functionality that needs it will raise a clear ImportError at call time instead of failing on import.
- Further improvements can be explored by applying similar allocation/device-placement strategies in other hot paths.

If you’d like, I can profile other paths or expand optimizations similarly.
